title: Linked Data Metrics for Flexible Expert Search on the open Web

introducer: Jens Lehmann, Department of Business Information Systems, University of Leipzig
author: Milan Stankovic, Hypios SAS

On the web approach where we try to bridge together the companies who have industry problems, innovation problems with with people who have knowledge.

Because our assumption is that when you're looking for an expert in a particular topic, it would significantly depend on the topic on how you would actually do it.
You wouldn't search for an expert in Java coding in the same way you are searching for an expert in quantum physics.
They are found on different places.
They leave different kinds of traces.

So our assumption is, and if you look at the social science literature, you will see that this is already claimed that communities, different experts, communities use different kinds of media to communicate and as a consequence they leave different kinds of user traces.
So what we wanted is to design an approach which would be flexible enough so that it can work with virtually any topic of expertise that could leverage the link data and actually suggest.
First suggest the way how you would look for an expert in a particular topic in all this massive data.

If you like, which enables you to conclude having having a user trace or a number of user traces that a particular user is an expert in the field.
